description: The trusted platform that releases the collective might of the faith ecosystem

funding.raw: Gloo Holdings, Inc., a technology platform serving the faith ecosystem, completed its U.S. initial public offering (IPO) on November 19, 2025, raising $72.8 million. The shares were priced at $8 each, valuing the company at $586 million. Roth Capital Partners acted as the sole book-running manager for the offering. This IPO follows a $110 million strategic growth investment secured by Gloo on July 31, 2024.

recent_news: Since January 1st, 2025, Gloo has been active in several key areas. The company launched an Initial Public Offering (IPO) in November 2025 and reported its third fiscal quarter 2025 financial results in December 2025. Gloo has expanded its market reach through strategic acquisitions, including XRI Global for advanced AI capabilities (November 2025), and Igniter (September 2025) and Masterworks (July 2025) in faith-focused media and fundraising. They also opened a new office in Silicon Valley in October 2025. Gloo has made multiple strategic investments in companies such as Midwestern (January 2025), VisitorReach (January 2025), Servant (April 2025), Carey Nieuwhof (March 2025), and Masterworks (July 2025). In terms of marketing and AI development, Gloo has promoted its values-aligned AI through initiatives like an AI benchmark released in December 2025 and an AI hackathon in October 2025, and by bringing AI solutions to media professionals in January 2025. A notable leadership change occurred with Pat Gelsinger's appointment as Executive Chair and Head of Technology in March 2025. Gloo has also strengthened its partnerships, including a deeper collaboration with Barna Group (March 2025), a partnership with Faith Assistant (January 2025), and a new strategic technology partnership with InterVarsity Christian Fellowship/USA (January 2026). No specific rebranding initiatives or industry awards were mentioned in the provided results.

economic_buyer.name: Rebecca Mann Kelly
economic_buyer.title: Chief Growth Officer

economic_buyer.linkedin_summary: Rebecca Mann Kelly's public LinkedIn activity primarily showcases her thought leadership in the fintech sector through published articles. Her most recent article, from January 2024, analyzed the fintech landscape for that year, discussing key developments like layoffs, M&A, and the growth of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL). An earlier article from May 2020 emphasized the critical need for innovation in cross-border payments for financial institutions.

recommended_sequence.angle: Executive-level value prop with internal context

analysis.why_now: Rebecca Mann Kelly is first 6 months into their role—the window for new partnerships is open now but closes as they settle into existing vendor relationships. Recent news shows active company momentum (product launches, partnerships)—web presence needs to keep pace with business growth. They're early in their Webflow journey (3 projects)—now is the time to establish VAN as their go-to Webflow partner before they build internal muscle or find another agency. Post-funding momentum (Growth, 2 months ago) means budget is available for strategic initiatives.
analysis.why_van: VAN's deep Webflow expertise is directly relevant—they're already invested in the platform and need a partner who can help them maximize that investment. Multiple marketing stakeholders suggests a team that needs agency support—VAN's network model provides the breadth of expertise they need without managing multiple vendor relationships.

research_gaps: No LinkedIn activity data available—limits personalization for outreach
No funding data—unable to assess budget timing
